content: Awesome game, mediocre implementation on mobile. The game itself is just awesome and warrants five stars, However its implementation on a mobile device suffers from very inaccurate controls. Things like accidentally jumping when you wanted to back flip or just move your worm  which is close to the side of the screen (yeah, onto a mine or into the water), or inadvertently setting off a secondary weapon off a rope/parachute, are a bit too common, which annoyingly ruins good games.

The game is over all good but the touch aim system is not sensitive or accurate at all making it very difficult to be combat effective also the AI is way to OP and always hits it's target very unbalanced in that sense and the fact that some weapons do little damage sometimes and alot more other times need a to rebalance and adjustment of aim system imo
It's a pretty good version based on the original. Frustratingly, it doesn't seem to be possible to add this to your Google family library.

After playing this on a friends PS3 I was quite interested to find it was available for my phone. So promptly bought it. I made my way from quick games through the campaign levels. I did enjoy playing it but don't think it translates well to a small touch screen without a real control buttons.  There is no specific on screen button to move, jump or back flip. Only touching the worm a certain way or sides of screen. For this reason it tends to misinterpret you in the most annoying moment. For example I found if there is water right below and I needed to back flip out of danger it almost always jumped into the water instead! As if it did it on purpose because the game thought it would be funny to kill you. It isn't easy to scroll either, requiring two fingers to drag around, and by the time you get that working the game can zoom out and/or walk your worm off a cliff into doom which you didn't see. Also you can't really move around the edges of the screen as it can't seem to detect you want to move out and the worm just jumps in the wrong direction. So I think the game could be made easier to work on a touch screen with on screen movement buttons and dragging screen to scroll.
Iam having trouble with lvl 29 trying to past it and it a hard a few hints would be great

content: Worms. Played Worms Armageddon? This is the same game pretty much, except there's no plot to any mission and the AI is trippin' ballz. The AI will sometimes make perfect near-impossible shot, and on the next turn, they'll stick a dynamite on your head and stay right there, probably to witness your death. Sometimes, they shoot a mile away from anything and it makes you wonder what it was trying to even do. If you can deal with no plot and poor AI, there's also the control. They're okay, but when you close to the edge of the map, you may find yourself unable to move closer to it without jumping around. Sometimes there is sound issues with the game. No jumping sounds, no explosions, no whatever. Apparently it has been fixed but it still happens to not work sometimes. Weapon variety is good enough. Customisation to our teams are a cool add-on. Online and local multiplayer are a must, and they're there!  I think it was mostly developped with multiplayer in mind. I like the game, but the bad AI makes me quit quickly.

content: This brings back hours of great memories playing with friends. Touch screen controls are so frustrating that I want to throw the phone across the room.  Great translation to small screen terrible control scheme.

Pros:  + Surprisingly Large Hat Variety  +Very Basic Turned Based System and addicting to play +Nice Team Customization +Able to have up to 16 people in one game with many different teams  +Simple yet sweet graphics  + Lots of weapons for an older worms game  Cons:  -Horrible Controls  -Very boring and weak campaign mode -No online multiplayer  -Only one worm class  Overall this is a pretty soild worms game the controls are it's biggest downfall for me tbh but the game is fun to play and I have to consider that this is an older installment so there isn't gonna be much but I do like the simpleness that comes within this game but because there isn't much to offer still I'm gonna have to give this three stars still a decent game though.

content: I was expecting a PC-perfect port of Worms Armageddon.  About the only similarities are the sounds.  Significant differences include: - if a hill is steep, you will slide down it - got a keyboard and mouse?  Too bad: it's no good.  You're trapped in the touchscreen - the graphics are different - jumping range is different for vertical, forward, and backflips - wind handling and napalm are different - minigun / uzi is ineffective - worms tend to stand their ground better in the Android version when they're hit  This changes the dynamics of nearly everything with regard to gameplay.  If you've played the original you will likely be disappointed because this is not the same game.  Still, it's not a bad game, but this garners 3 instead of 5.  Terrible port, okay game.
I love worms last few levels are a bit hard

It's a small issue but can really mess you up when your turn is timed!   (Galaxy S4, not kitkat)
The game is great but aiming can be a bit twitchy and the game lacks an explanation a on each weapon. With these features added i would be happy to rate 5 stars.

content: Game play is what you love from worms however the controls often do the wrong thing and kill you or make you waste your turn. Poor GUI feedback makes it difficult to tell why some things won't shoot.  The difficulty curve is also really punishing. I love a challenge but by world 9 if you miss one shot you're dead. Opponents will ace you perfectly with shots involving wind from the other side of the map. Alright for multiplayer with friends and humans but the AI is brutally hard and so perfect it's not fun.
Definitely a great game, but I haven't been able to sync my Worms games between my Android devices.  Even when I sign in to Google+ the accounts don't seem to connect.

Ultimately had to uninstall.  It was consuming over 1gb of RAM and causing all other programs to crash.  This is on an HTC One .  Game itself was fine, entertaining, worth the price.  But yeah, not worth making my entire system unstable.
Great game but could you add a bug where if you accidently unistall it it saves your progress
Great

I was a huge Worms fan on PC, and I really wanted to like this version on Android. But unfortunately, I just don't think it's working here. Limited to just four worms per team, controls are clunky and unintuitive, multiplayer connectivity is horrid, and the game just doesn't have the charm it once had. Also, the AI is very poorly balanced - it's either suicidally stupid or 100% accurate, with basically nothing in between. Very disappointed.

Overall its a very fun addicting game. Always been a fan of worms and this mobile apps promises what worms can do on mobile! Its worth it, controls are decent, I have problems with the aiming and jumping but other then that a really well made app! Must buy

Its a harder more scammier game than the origonal, there is a smaller variety of weapons and is overall boring over time. It was a waste of my money. BOOO!

Probably should have focused on making the game more challenging by other means rather than letting the enemy win. Impossible shots placed by the AI, convenient placement of health crates that helps the enemy and I swear to god everytime I place a good shot the enemy is left with 1% of health and kills me on the next turn with some insane move... I played worms since I was 7 and I don't remember any of this bs. Don't buy it.

The game is close to the Worms I remember but there are several massive problems.  One is the AI they are hyper accurate with every shot.  You find yourself out numbered by more then two to one margins each match.  Have also noticed the AI ignoring where is no land to jump and land in mid air to fire a shot.  Another major issue is the gold you get for completing campaign, it is virtually useless when buying weapons that are available, they don't show up in campaign where they would be useful.
Its good, although rather glitchy and often slow even on my SGS2 but fun nonetheless. Can't wait to see what comes next with this game!  :-)

content: Great game, highly recommend and not free to play!!!

The best

I love this game,  I always play it on the tube and bus,  it is fun, I would definitely recommend it to anyone, and you don't need an Internet connection to play which is also nice.  The reason why I gave only 4 stars, though, is that the game changes from challenging to unfair, frustrating after a while. I was stuck for days on the 25th level of the campaign, your 2 worms vs 9. And the enemy is very pro. And later it turned to 2v12. I know it was meant to be challenging but maybe you overdid it a bit.
Campaign completed. 34 is the most difficult one. It becomes boring if you have to play 30 times to accomplish one level only if you get lucky.

Worms really lends itself to a touch screen device. Enjoying this game a lot more than I thought I would.  My only gripes are heavy battery use and double jump not working on occasion. Thanks for supporting Android and Linux Team 17!

content: Sound frequently doesn't work on Nexus 5, and controls can be very clumsy. Worms has always been a fun game, but I'd much rather play on a different platform.  Edit: thanks for the reply Team 17; even when the sound did work, the clumsiness of the controls was the real reason I abandoned this release. After the nth time my worm jumped into the sea instead of just wriggling forward, I couldn't take the frustration any more.  I'm sure it works better on tablets, but on a phone-sized screen there just isn't enough room for comfortable controls.  So yeah, don't get me wrong, Worms is an all-time favorite gam of mine, but it did not work for me on an Android phone.

content: The developer has opted for the classic tap either side of the screen to move and drag the reticle to aim touch control system, it does not support controller or keyboard input. The result is a control system that is borderline unresponsive and makes fine movement or fast movement completely inefficient. This game is so tedious to play, it certainly isn't worth the hefty price tag associated with it. If you bought this during the sale; you got a great deal, but as someone who paid full price to support Team 17, I'm disappointed in this lackluster port. Overall the game is a great example of what can happen to a great idea when it's executed poorly. I am however, happy to give Team 17 a few extra dollars, and hope they make improvements over time.

In a world of mostly terrible mobile games, somehow these people have brought the amazing game of Worms we grew up playing, from PS1 to the palm of my hand with better ability and graphics then I've ever seen!  Struggling to connect to the network, but it could be on my end.  Wonderful game Team 17.  Well done...

content: I noticed something odd and I'm not sure if it is a bug or a setting that I missed. When I play in hotseat mode I can't move my worms. They are just stuck in place. I can do everything else but I can't move them or jump with them. Please fix this and you'll get 5 stars
replyContent:
Hey Alex,

It sounds like you're playing a custom game mode with artillery mode enabled. Please disable artillery mode in your custom game settings, as this will cause all of your worms to remain still in hotseat games when enabled.

Thanks,

Team17 Support.

content: Funny and cool really good and fun

Like the game, however the controls can be somewhat difficult to master, and even still not always respond.   Also, I've found the difficulty to be a joke. "easy" is anything but and the AI players can thread a missile thru a tight spot, bounce a grenade with wind assist across the map to perfectly land on my worm and knock me in the water. The difficulty modes need to be adjusted to properly reflect what it's called. Easy is hard, hard is, well just silly, the computer is far far to accurate to simulate playing actual people... Hope there'll be an update to address this. And just to add, I've noticed a few times where the AI will land on a mine and the mine won't go off, yet everytime a mine is blown across the map to MY worm, it ends in a boom and a loss for me.
Games cannot be saved in middle of a match. must be connected to internet to play
Never gets old.
Downloaded it for tablet and phone. Almost exactly like the console version. Easy to use on the touchscreen and works a dream on both my tablet and phone. Definitely worth the money !
Needs controller support..
A few bugs and problems but overall a very good PC to Android app!

i played the original worms armageddon (the 1999 game) on pc but this android port is a huge disappointment at best. the campaign is boring, always just "kill all enemy worms". multiplayer is nonexistent. nobody hosts a game and it's very difficult to get into a match. also very boring level design! worms armageddon had iconic maps like the junkyard, my favorite map! but in worms 2 armageddon, all maps look the same. funny voice cues by worms (like when jumping) are missing. only four worms per team. dlcs with more weapons/customization missing in this version (??). no handheld flamethrower (WHY? it was the most fun weapon to use), no handheld minigun. napalm strike is highly underpowered. artificial intelligence is bad, harder enemies are always dead accurate and they never do mistakes

content: Awesome
Thanks again T17, please never stop making the game we love.

Controls are a little clunky. Sometimes it's hard to see where the tethered aiming crosshair is because your own finger is in the way.  It would be better to aim precisely, maybe with up/down buttons like are used in pool games.  It's hard to control your worm in the far side of an enclosed map because the worm doesn't know whether to jump or inch forward.   Also I wish we had the ability to use the Internet to search for games instead of only LAN

I've never played a game where bots cheat this much. Seriously. They get bazooka hits from literally across the map with obstacles even in the way. Item spawns land literally on top of or next to enemies whereas the closest ones next to me land on mines.  Shoddy controls as well. An interactive tutorial would've helped so much for newcomers like me instead of having to go back and forth between options and practice mode. Cheating and controls ruin the game 1/5

content: Question to devs; Worms 2 on the pc was released in 1998, it was, and still is, an incredible game, allowing great customisation to game modes, a vast arsenal of weaponry,  up to 8 worms on a team, worm select options, and SO much more. Edit: Need to write the list of errors since I've given it more time. But for now...DO NOT BUY THIS INCREDIBLY POOR VERSION!**Even on easy the enemies have perfect precision yet you have distorted precision. content: A faithful representation of the Worms of old, and it's addictive too!  Controls are a bit tricky at first, but you get the hang of them (although I sometimes accidentally hit the wrong button).  My only issue is with multiplayer - it's difficult to connect, and the games don't seem to allow for more than one round, or more than two players.  Also I played someone who seemed to be able to manipulate the game and cheat - hmm!  But all in all, very good.

This is worms at its best. No IAP's! You can get extra levels but you buy them with coins you earn playing campaign mode. Real good work T17. Only bug I can find is if...  1. Turn the sound effects and music off.  2. Quit the game.  3. Re-open the game and continue where you left off.  4. Turn the sounds back on.   The sounds do not turn back on.
Great game! Occasional load issues. Also, the worms pretty much never miss.
It would be great if you could add more achievements! :)
Everything is good except needs improvement on jumping in a specific direction.
I play this game every day at lunch with three of my friends. It is one of the best things ever. The pass and play is perfect and the gameplay flawless. By far in my top five games EVER.
I play this on my Samsung Tab 2.  Works perfectly, no bugs or crashes at all in over 20 hours of gameplay.  Game is just as entertaining as it always was.  Controls are well thought out too.
Its a perfect port from the original game. Despite the rare control issues in game, everything works soundly and I love the online feature.
Everything is great and works well but just fix the online play and then it would deserve five stars !!

content: How to play with 2 created teams 1vs1 in same phone???  Thanks for fast answer. Now everything almost perfect :)
replyContent:
Hey Vytautas,
Please click the red Cog icon on the main menu screen. Enter Team Settings and create two teams by pressing the worm with the + on him. Please go back to the main menu, press Play, select Multiplayer, select Hotseat Game and add the two teams you made earlier as human players. If this doesn't work, contact support@team17.com.
Thanks.

Custom game styles are currently for use in Hotseat multiplayer games only, for games against AI teams or for pass-and-play games between human teams - or a mixture of the two.

Thank you,
Team17 Support

So you have to launch the game once per month to play hassle free.
replyContent:
Hi John,
Please note: we have sent you an email response regarding your concerns. To clarify, the game doesn't require a constant connection & only requires an authentication to be carried out once every 30 days. After  this, you'll be able to play the game off-line. 
Additionally, we would like to request that you do not promote piracy. 
Thank you

content: Now the game to me in the single player mode/hard mode is toooooo easy.  because I can easily get so many wins, although I loose some because of my bad strategic choices. Why I am giving 4/5 stars? Now, using  touch controls make me make moves that I did not really ask for. This is seriously annoying. add that this should be given the chance to be played on Logitech Revue Google TV by /ONLY/ setting the manifest with the following two lines:  <uses-feature android:name="android.hardware.touchscreen" android:required="false"/> <uses-feature android:name="android.hardware.screen.portrait" android:required="false"/> Although I admit that I am NOT a game developer and will never be, but I am trying to tell the world that just two lines of code ONLY are required to turn it to work on devices similar to Google TV.  Also! mates! where is that sexy girl voice of the PC version?! And where is the map builder? And in the single hard mode please allow the baseball bat Anyways, Thanks for the beautiful game.

content: Love this game!!!

Would be better if they had all the training of other Worms games. Campaign is very fun. Game is fun period. Would like to see custom battles as in other games in the series, or even a direct port of the original Worms Armageddon.

If you're buying this game purely for single player, don't bother. It will frustrate you beyond comprehension. Ninety percent of the time, the AI will execute ridiculously impossible shots that thread a rocket through the tiniest hole in the terrain despite heavy wind. Or the other 10%, the AI will do something inexplicably stupid like shoot a shotgun at a bare wall, or fire a rocket at terrain that's right in front. The controls are also excrement. Its too easy to jump into the water when merely scrolling.

It's the classic worms I remember from years ago on PC, but I've found too many frustrations to keep playing it. Multiplayer games are difficult to setup up or join and are constantly stopping to search for new players. For some reason you can only play online over WiFi and not on 3G.  The difficulty level in single player campaign is all over the place, levels 20 and 28 are way harder than anything else and seen impossible. Now I'm stuck on the campaign and can't find an online match it's time to uninstall
Can't play online against my friends... A game like Worms definitely needs Google+ integration for online play and achievements.
Don't try to play the game on a crappy tablet or phone and you'll be fine.

Fun game, abysmal controls and AI.  Why on earth team 17 opted for touch controls instead of virtual arrows or a d-pad, I have no idea. Now the AI: uses grenades or bazooka about 90 percent of the time with absolute perfection. Calculating wind speeds and never missing a single shot even if it is necessary to shoot in the complete opposite direction and rely solely on wind. Please make it more human and make it use the other weapons a lot more often. Plus the campaign is just skirmish,  no actual missions.
It would be nice to play with more than one folk in multiplayer mode.
Works like a charm on my Nexus 10. Sharp graphics.
Horrible controls
Amazing game, hope it keeps getting updated with new features, there's great potential in this game.
I love this game I can cannot put it down
After 35 extremely Entertaining & Difficult  levels I have beat it!!!!
network games are useless without cross-platorm support. Fix and will change rating
Love this classic

You NEED 2G of RAM to play this game. Samsung gs3 or newer should be fine. Works perfect on my phone but seems anyone with sub par phone they lag ouy and makes me force stop. Gets quite laborious... Other than that works great! Ppl with under 2g RAM stick to campaign PLEEEASE....

and it's simply meh, OK. I've bought Worms games at least 20 times in my life but now twice on Android as I also bought the, even worse than this, EA game. When I contacted Team 17 they basically told me to get lost. The controls are horrible and I can never figure out how to pan or move around, which always causes errors and deaths. The first time I used the jetpack I flew into the roof and lost my turn. Even now using the jetpack is downright difficult! The graphics and textures are low quality and drab. The best version that remains to this day is the NGage Worms. Don't bother wasting your time or money with this EXPENSIVE game! For $2.49 on sale it wasn't worth it so don't spend $4.99, Team 17 has some nerve!
replyContent:
Hey Brandon,

As we said in our email, the original Worms was completely developed and published by EA - you'll have to contact them regarding support and refunds.

As we didn't hear a response to our email, we imagined that you were satisfied with your response. You're still welcome to email back with feedback.

Team17 Support.

content: Private multiplayer games, the specific reason for which I purchased this game, are beyond broken. Firstly, custom settings selected for those games do not remain set. It seems to activate sudden death and choose match length pretty much randomly. Secondly, Private matches entirely fail to connect approximately 80 percent of the time. Another ten percent of the time, they disconnect immediately at the beginning when the "start game" button is pressed. Another five percent of the time, the match disconnects all players once the level generates. For 1/20 of a good multiplayer game that remains? One star. Please fix this. It's an abominable treatment for such a classic title.

First: When creating a custom game I set wins to 2, turn to 90, round to 0 and Health to 200. Save. Go into game, Health is 1 round is 0 timer 45 and wins are set to 2 but it drops all players after the game. 1 star just for that frustration.  Second: WiFi games drop out. It's random on when it decides to connect and there is ZERO explanation of what any of the icons do at the bottom of the screen. Labels would be awesome for people who just want to jump in and play.  Not worth the money unless they fix it.
Very smooth gameplay, looks like good old worms, but the controls I found were a little difficult. With practice that might change though. Worth the money easily if you're a fan of worms.

This game would be fantastic, but it keeps freezing and saying "waiting for the other player" when playing multiplayer. It's impossible to have a decent multiplayer game. In fact the multiplayer is not very good. Please, please update and repair the server issue that seems to be causing the problem. It would be 5 stars if the multiplayer worked properly.

Playing with friends is really good fun. The same cannot be said for single player, the AI are either really stupid, or really good and hit constant impossible shots. Would not recommend if you don't have any friends to play with as single player really is that bad.
This game is ok. But it likes to crash on me. Even more so is multiplayer. Please fix.

This version of worms 2 is almost perfect.  The graphics are great , the controls are almost perfect.  I think it only needs some kind of circle around items like the girder , that would let you know how far away from the item you need to place your finger to drag and move it around before placing it.  I sometimes try to make a tiny adjustment, but end up moving the girder to where i placed my finger, and must replace it again , wasting precious seconds.  And then there is the length of the campaign mode ... way too short! Any worms veteran (like me, who's been playing since the DOS days of Worms 1) Will have no trouble clearing the entire campaign in just a few hours.  It would also benefit from multiplayer over 3G/4G/LTE because after all, a lot of us play it on our phones ..  I haven't seen any game breaking bugs, just this once the touch controls stuck, and I had to restart the game, same problem that is plaguing the first Worms released on android, which is just not playable on the galaxy line of samsung phones running ICS and up.   Please , pretty please , add more campaign missions!

This is an excellent adaptation of Worms. It works great on my Nexus 4 and Nexus 7.  You can play multiplayer either on the same device, on the same wifi network, or even over the internet. You can play with random players and join random games, or you can host a private game and someone else (that knows the game name) can join directly. As long as you're both connected to the internet via WIFI it doesn't matter where you are. I play with relatives at the other side of the country!  The disadvantages are, teams are limited to 4 worms so you can't have huge epic firefights. You can't use custom presets in multiplayer, so you're limited in what you can customise. I prefer having either no time limit or a 5 minute limit for turns for ninja roping fun, but this isn't an option.  Campaign isn't as interesting as some versions of worms, and there are a couple of graphical glitches on the Nexus where the edges are cut off. It also doesn't play sounds as frequently as the other versions. I miss "...What was that?!" when you mess up a shot and miss completely.  The replays seem to be random rather than on good shots. No bounce option on grenades, no bungee.  Otherwise, thumbs up!

replyContent:
Hey Zachary, 

The equivalent game to Worms 2: Armageddon on PC would be Worms Reloaded, not Worms World Party. Zero gravity is not a feature of this game, but Poison Strike and Gas Pump are featured.

You can re-name worms by selecting the red cog icon on the 'PLAY' menu, and perform full customisations on your team.

Thank you,
Team17 Support.

You can use your currently selected team automatically in body count and campaign. You can select your team on the create/join network game screen, to play online multiplayer, or on the lobby screen in hotseat multiplayer.

Quick game and Practice match do not use created teamd, instead using a default team.

Thanks,
Team17 Support.

The game is fun to play both with friends and solo. Someone mentioned loading issues when offline, so that was the first thing I checked out. I'm happy to report that the game runs like charm even on airplane mode! Graphics look great even on the screen of my Nexus 10.   Used to have some glitches, when reported, I was contacted promptly by support.   The game is best played from phone with the screen mirrored to a TV with friends.   Alternatively, campaign mode provides steadily increasing level of challenge.

content: They did an amazing job bringing one of my favorite games to android devices.

Brilliant fun, and one of the best online multiplayer enabled games I've ever played on mobile.  Weapons control fine, however player movement is mechanical, and very flawed.  I do a lot of unintended jumping, and walking off a ledge.  In general the player physical movement is unintuitive, and not sufficiently explained in the tutorial/documentation.  Expect to die a lot simply because you unintentionally jumped.  I have no idea how one is supposed to simply fly vertically in a straight line with these movement controls.  But other than those small issues, BRILLIANT game, that every mobile gamer owes it to themselves to at least try once.
Great game still after all this time, needs mobile net support instead of WiFi all the time. Great time killer!

content: Samsung Galaxy s2 (19100T) Running 4.0.3. After following the steps provided by emailing Team17 I can report... Nothing. The app fails to launch with a window "Application not Licensed". I have emailed Team 17, below are the responses; "Hello whenever I launch the application I get the message "Application not licensed" etc and cannot proceed any further.  I have forced stop>cleared data>uninstalled> rebooted  then re-installed now 3 times, and nothing has worked.  Quite frankly guys, this is kind of unacceptable, did you not beta test? I understand that your software must be cross platform and cope with all devices of all ages and shapes but for a Galaxy s 2 on ICS, this is slightly concerning."  Team17 responded: "Sorry to hear that you‚Äôre experiencing issues with Worms 2: Armageddon.   Could you please let us know the internet connection method that you are using when attempting to verify the license? (Wi-Fi, 3G, 4G or other data connection)"  Now Team17 are passing the blame to Google Play's Licensing server, strange never had a problem before, their words; "The issue may lie with the Google Play licensing server. The issue may have automatically resolved itself"
replyContent:
Hey Charly,

We've tweaked the license check so that it only occurs once a month. Please let us know if you still have any issues.

For any application, the license must sync to your Google account. You can check sync status in Settings - Accounts - Google.

Thanks,
Team17 Support

content: very good and easy to play just like the good old days!! a must have for any android device!!

Worms like we all remember it from the 90's (or pretty close to it). My only complaints are the slightly wacky (but not terrible) controls (in particular, aiming can be problematic because one's finger covers the crosshair while aiming, and jumping requires tapping in just the right place) and the atrociously slow load times of the levels (between 12 and 15 seconds on average, while we see the terrain being (slowly) rendered (even on a relatively fast Nexus 7)). (Rendering of the levels was faster on my 120MHz Pentium back in the late 1990's!) Use the Practice Mode to get used to the controls, then get ready for some good Worm-blasting fun. Includes the super-weapons old fans know and love, such as The Donkey and Meteor Strike.

Looks great but how on earth can you pay it without wanting to throw your phone?	How is it that Snails,  a ripoff if Worms, was able to get the controls so perfect nearly 10 years ago on PocketPC, but Worms can't even come close almost a decade later on much more powerful platforms?   The control is too touchy, then not touchy enough,  then nonexistent. It's all over the place and nowhere all at once. It's unplayable.
Still a great mix of strategy and skill

Giving this game three stars because of finally being able to play Worms multiplayer on Android, but I have a bunch of concerns/improvements to suggest:  1. Controls are very confusing. Trying to touch different areas of the screen for movement/weapons controls is not very intuitive and needs work. I agree with James Corner's review and the need for control customization. Being a longtime Worms user, I can adapt to the new controls, but new users may find it very difficult to adjust to. 2. Needs asynchronous play, a feature present in the iPhone version. Playing an entire game can be time consuming; I would like to be able to play individual turns with my friends when I have a spare minute or two. 3. No Facebook integration. VERY IMPORTANT! I have friends who love Worms but no way to play with them without a private game/password, which is unbelievably cumbersome. Allow me to invite Facebook friends to play, or see who has it installed on their phone. 4. Cross compatibility with iOS version, if possible.  Overall, I give you a solid "Needs Improvement." I'm happy that this version is available, but it needs a lot of tweaks before I can fully support it.
Had completely written worms off when EA took over. Some how missed the news of team 17 re-acquiring it, so this came as a pleasant surprise this morning. So far its playing great for me.

content: Gameplay is good, but is held back by the controls. They are non intuitive and awkward to use when you do figure them out.  Aiming precisely is difficult as you have to put your finger over the aiming target to move it, so you can't see exactly where it is. Would like to be able to toggle between move and aim modes. The weapons that allow you to aim freely (like air strike) also didn't seem to work very well.   Had to search through the how to play section in the settings (which itself wasn't easy to find being only accessible on the initial splash screen) to figure out how to look around the levels.   Other than the controls the game functioned well, levels loaded quickly and no crashes. Hopefully the controls can be improved so the game can live up to its wormy potential.
it hard game tho worth the money
